root.title: Root
root.popupdesc: The root is the meaning of the word - all other grammar features are to hopefully specify which of the many meanings of the root you are referring to. Check the Lexicon (by kay(f)bop(t) / by English).

case.title: Case

NOM.name: Nominative
NOM.desc: Marks the subject of the verb.

ACC.name: Accusative
ACC.desc: Marks the direct object of the verb.

BRF.name: Brief
BRF.desc: Used to signify nouns as background information (primarily used in legal or business documents).

SUI.name: Suit
SUI.desc: Used to describe location in a far off place (usually used for travel).

JUS.name: Justin
JUS.desc: Topicalizes hypothetical situations with low probability.

case.popupdesc: Cases are the role of the noun in a sentence with relation to the verb.

num.title: Number

FIN.name: Finite
FIN.desc: The word describes a finite amount of something, or a finite concept.

INF.name: Infinite
INF.desc: The word describes either an infinite amount of something, or an infinite concept.

num.popupdesc:
Describes whether a word is finite or infinite.
For verbs, this must instead match the subject (NOM).

exp.title: Expectation

Y.name: Yes
Y.desc: The word matches the speaker's expectations.

N.name: No
N.desc: The word does not match the speaker's expectations.

YB.name: Yes, but not to that extent
YB.desc: The word matches the speaker's expectations, but not by that much.

exp.popupdesc: Whether the word matches the speaker's expectations or not.

food.title: Is food?
food.popupdesc: Describes whether the word is food or not. You are free to interpret whether this means simply edible, or is treated as food in this current context.

gdr.title: Gender

NHM.name: Non-Human Metazoan
NHM.desc: A non-human creature in the kingdom of Metazoa, or an "animal".

NMO.name: Non-Metazoan Opisthokonts
NMO.desc: A non-metazoan creature in the group of Opisthokont, or a "fungus".

AGI.name: Angiosperms
AGI.desc: A member of the clade Angiospermae, or a "flowering plant".

GYM.name: Gymnosperms
GYM.desc: A member of the group Gymnospermae, or a "seed-producing plant" that is not a member of Angiospermae.

SIL.name: Silicate Minerals
SIL.desc: Any mineral made up of silicate groups. (Wikipedia)

OTH.name: Other
OTH.desc: If, somehow, you are referring to something that does not fall into one of the above categories, use this gender instead.

gdr.popupdesc: Which group of thing this word refers to.

death.title: Manner of Death
death.popupdesc: How the noun died, or, if it is still alive, how you expect the noun will die.

awe.title: Awesomeness
awe.popupdesc:
How awesome the word is.
As we all know, this is completely objective.

mv.title: Market Value
mv.popupdesc:
The approximate market value of the word in USD.
As this is a number, it must not be negative or contain a zero.

mvlog.title: log(Market Value)?
mvlog.popupdesc: The number in the Market Value input should have a log (base 10) applied to it first.

ment.title: Mental State
ment.popupdesc: The mental state of the speaker.

day.title: Day of the Week

SU.name: Sunday
SU.desc: I would prefer this being at the end of the list, but I'm going off of how the official website lists them.

F13.name: Friday the 13th
F13.desc: Use instead of Friday on Fridays which are the 13th of the month.

day.popupdesc: Which day of the week it is.

lie.title: Degree to which the Speaker is Lying

MSL.name: The Statement is True But Misleading

lie.popupdesc: Yes, you do have to be truthful about this.

bread.title: Smaller than a breadbox?
bread.popupdesc: Is the subject smaller than a breadbox?

ebar.title: Error Bars (%)
ebar.popupdesc:
The error bars on your statement, as a percentage.
As this is a number, it must not be negative or contain a zero.

pro.title: I/You/There?
pro.popupdesc:
Is this noun "I", "you" or "there"?
Don't forget that pronouns other than “I” and “you” must be declared with the verb “dan(f)yist(t)a(b)mar(b)ap(t)”, which takes the pronoun as subject and the referent as object.

numroot.title: Root (Number)
numroot.popupdesc:
The root is the meaning of the word - this specific word is a number.
As this is a number, it must not be negative or contain a zero.

isanum.title: Use number as root?
isanum.popupdesc: Check this if you would like to use a number for the root - use this instead of typing in the root manually.

stddev.title: Standard Deviations from Average
stddev.popupdesc:
The number of standard deviations from the mean (adjective/adverb)-ness your desired quality is.
As this is a number, it must not be negative or contain a zero.
As negatives are not allowed, this number refers to either direction.

fword.title: Is a function word?
fword.popupdesc: Check this box if this word is a function word.

idiot.title: Is the addressee's grasp of kay(f)bop(t) lacking?
idiot.popupdesc: Check this box if the addressee is a (young) child, a foreigner, or someone whose intellegence you wish to insult.

funcplus.title: Arbitrary syllables
funcplus.popupdesc:
If the word is a function word and the addressee's grasp of kay(f)bop(t) is lacking, add as many arbitrary syllables here as you wish.
Ideally, they will be as hard to pronounce as possible.
